nodes.label: Complex Systems
nodes.description: Emergent, dynamic, and nonlinear systems across natural and artificial domains.

nodes.label: Artificial Life
nodes.description: The design and study of life-like behaviors in software and machines. Includes generative systems, synthetic biology, open-ended evolution, and adaptive autonomy.

nodes.label: Probabilistic Computing
nodes.description: Structured reasoning under uncertainty and statistical inference.

nodes.label: Simulation
nodes.description: Digital models of behavior, cities, systems, and agents.

nodes.label: Cognitive Science
nodes.description: Study of knowledge, reasoning, memory, perception, attention, judgment, and decision-making.

nodes.label: Neurodiversity
nodes.description: Design for and study of cognitive differences and inclusion.

nodes.label: Design Thinking
nodes.description: Creative and iterative problem-solving methods.

nodes.label: Speculative Design
nodes.description: Critical design that imagines alternative futures.

nodes.label: Technology Policy
nodes.description: Law and regulation frameworks for technology and society.

nodes.label: Governance Architecture
nodes.description: Design of institutions, rules, and collective norms.

nodes.label: Digital Identity
nodes.description: Self-expression and reputation systems online.

nodes.label: Platform Ethics
nodes.description: Ethical issues in user experience, attention, and digital life.

nodes.label: Cultural Contexts
nodes.description: Values, narratives, and meaning-making across societies.

nodes.label: Gender & Technology
nodes.description: Power and identity examined through technical systems.

nodes.label: Participatory Interfaces
nodes.description: Interactive systems built for feedback and engagement.

nodes.label: Education Systems
nodes.description: The structure and transformation of teaching and learning.

nodes.label: Intentional Design
nodes.description: Feedback-driven frameworks that align effort with impact, including systems for time design, productivity, decision-making, and reflective evaluation across personal and institutional scales.

nodes.label: Knowledge Representation
nodes.description: Structures for modeling, accessing, and organizing information.

nodes.label: Collective Intelligence
nodes.description: Group cognition, coordination, and decision-making.

nodes.label: Digital Infrastructure
nodes.description: Civic tech, networks, protocols, and data systems.

nodes.label: Design Ethics
nodes.description: Moral reflection embedded in design decisions.

nodes.label: Aesthetic Forms
nodes.description: Visual and symbolic expression in cultural and technical systems.

nodes.label: Emotional Technology
nodes.description: Technology that engages, supports, or manipulates affect.

nodes.label: Institutional Resilience
nodes.description: Adaptability and longevity of socio-technical systems.

nodes.label: Embodied Intelligence
nodes.description: Systems that emphasize physical, biological, and spatial grounding in cognition, perception, interaction, and design. This includes embodied AI, sensorimotor intelligence, and biohybrid interaction.

nodes.label: Philosophy
nodes.description: Theoretical foundations of ethics, knowledge, and being, as applied to technology and complex systems.

nodes.label: Society
nodes.description: Social systems, norms, rituals, and the collective structures that shape human life.

nodes.label: Awareness
nodes.description: Investigation of conscious experience, perception, selfhood, and intersubjectivity—bridging biological, philosophical, and computational perspectives.

nodes.label: Rapid Prototyping
nodes.description: Design and fabrication processes that support fast, iterative development of ideas through tangible or testable outputs. Emphasizes experimentation, learning, and material feedback.

nodes.label: Machine Reasoning
nodes.description: Design of symbolic, statistical, and hybrid methods for rule-based logic, inference, and explainable decision-making in machines.

nodes.label: Cognitive Architecture
nodes.description: Study and construction of computational models that mimic or simulate human-like cognition—integrating memory, reasoning, and perception.

nodes.label: Story Telling
nodes.description: Design of environments, media, and narratives that communicate complex ideas, cultural values, or speculative futures through storytelling and experiential formats.

nodes.label: Incentives Design
nodes.description: Development of mechanisms—financial, social, or symbolic—that influence behavior, motivate participation, and shape organizational dynamics.

nodes.label: Novel Economics
nodes.description: Exploration of alternative economic models that challenge traditional assumptions about the nature of value, transactions, and growth.

nodes.label: Financial Engineering
nodes.description: Modeling, optimization, and structuring of financial instruments and systems—with applications in risk, sustainability, and experimental value creation.

nodes.label: Asian Sensibilities
nodes.description: Exploration of aesthetic, philosophical, and cultural values rooted in diverse Asian traditionsâ€”emphasizing harmony, relationality, impermanence, and context-aware design across art, technology, and society.
